paper_title: Variations on a result of Granville about polynomial invariance
abstract: In 2004, Andrew Granville proved the following: A polynomial in variables $x,y,z,$ invariant under the map $\varphi: z \to -(x+y+z)$ is a polynomial in $b = z(x+y+z)$. We tell, curtly, its history  and then give a variation on this theme.
